analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ni chos kun no //

translated: Therein, first, the praise of the nature of speech is stated:

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩdang po'i chos kyi sgras ni gsung gi rang bzhin gyi chos bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dang po'i chos kyi sgras ni gsung gi rang bzhin gyi chos bshad pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAmazing! ‚Äù and so forth.üîΩBy the first phrase, the nature of speech is explained.

original: gnyis pas ni brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: By the second, the nature of the object of expression is explained.

original: gsum pas ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gsum pas ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: By the third, the nature of intuition is explained.

original: chos kyi lam ji ltar bstan pa'i don yang dag par gyur pa ni chos kyi don byung ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi lam ji ltar bstan pa'i don yang dag par gyur pa ni chos kyi don byung ba ste /
translated: The arising of the object of the Dharma is the perfect realization of the meaning of the teaching of the path of Dharma.

original: @258a * // gsum pa 'di yang ngo mtshar yin no //
analyzed: @258a * // gsum pa 'di yang ngo mtshar yin no //
translated: This third is also amazing.

original: de bas na chos kyi rgyal po zhes gsungs te gsung gi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi rgyal po zhes gsungs te gsung gi rgyal po'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the King of Dharma, the King of Speech.

original: phyag 'tshal 'dud ces bya ba la khyed la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal 'dud ces bya ba la khyed la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase I pay homage to you is understood.

original: chos ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma is the nature of gnosis.

original: 'di las dag pas na chos dag pas so //
analyzed: 'di las dag pas na chos dag pas so //
translated: Since it is pure from this, it is pure Dharma.

original: 'di la don te yul bdag med pa yod pas na don bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la don te yul bdag med pa yod pas na don bdag med pa'o //
translated: It has the meaning of the object, selflessness, since it exists here. It is meaning selflessness.

original: 'dir chos kyi rgyal po'i sgras ni theg pa chen po ma lus pa 'am rdo rje theg pa dang gsang ba 'dus pa brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi rgyal po'i sgras ni theg pa chen po ma lus pa 'am rdo rje theg pa dang gsang ba 'dus pa brjod par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the word king of Dharma is intended to express the entire Great Vehicle or the Vajra Vehicle and the GuhyasamƒÅja.

original: sku'i rang bzhin du bstod pa ni sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sku'i rang bzhin du bstod pa ni sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The praise of the nature of the body is stated with the words body, speech, and mind.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rab tu dag pa ni brjod bya'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs rab tu dag pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rab tu dag pa ni brjod bya'i rang bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs rab tu dag pa'o //
translated: The purity of body, speech, and mind is the purity of body, speech, and mind because of the emptiness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject, which is the nature of the expressed meaning.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs dang yang dag par sbyor ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the very essence of the union of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, it is equal to space.

original: nam mkha' dang ni mnyam nyid gnas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni mnyam nyid gnas so //
translated: It abides as the equality of space.

original: de nyid kyis na de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: And for that very reason, since it is of one taste as suchness,

original: rnam par mi 'gyur snang ba med //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'gyur snang ba med //
translated: it is unchanging and non-apparent.

original: ces bya'o // rdo rje'i sku ni sku mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya'o // rdo rje'i sku ni sku mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The vajra body is so called because it is the indivisibility of the body.

original: thugs kyi rang bzhin du bstod pa thugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thugs kyi rang bzhin du bstod pa thugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The praise of the nature of mind is stated by ‚ÄúThe mind, which is the nature of the Tathagata, is the chief of all phenomena.

original: 'di de bzhin gshegs pa yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di de bzhin gshegs pa yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: It is the Tathagata because it is thus gone.

original: gtso bo ni mchog tu dbang du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ni mchog tu dbang du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the chief because it is the supreme lord.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ci tsam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ci tsam pa yin zhe na /
translated: How extensive is the Tathagata?

original: dus gsum dag gi lam du byung ba ste dus gsum ni dus nyid do //
analyzed: dus gsum dag gi lam du byung ba ste dus gsum ni dus nyid do //
translated: It is the path of the three times, and the three times are the very path.

original: de nyid ni lam yin te der byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni lam yin te der byung ba'o //
translated: It is the path because it arises there.

original: de nyid kyis ni go rims bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dbyings su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni go rims bzhin du chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dbyings su gyur pa'o //
translated: By that, respectively, he is the realm, because he is the essence of the pure realm of reality.

original: thugs rje chen po ni mchog tu rgyas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni mchog tu rgyas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion is the supreme expansion.

original: 'di nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i lam mnga' bas nam mkha'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'di nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i lam mnga' bas nam mkha'i lam ste /
translated: He has the path of space, because he has the path of space.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is eternal.

original: sku la sogs pa las tha dad par byas nas de'i phrin las kyi tshul du bstod pa ni nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa las tha dad par byas nas de'i phrin las kyi tshul du bstod pa ni nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having distinguished the body, etc., he praises the mode of his activity, saying, ‚ÄúSpace-body,‚Äù etc.

original: nam mkha'i sku ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i sku ni de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i sku'o //
translated: The space-body is the body of all the Tathagatas, which is of one taste in suchness.

original: de las yang dag par byung ba ni yang dag par skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las yang dag par byung ba ni yang dag par skyes pa'o //
translated: Arisen from that is perfectly arisen.

original: bdag med par ston pa'i gsung ni nam mkha'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: bdag med par ston pa'i gsung ni nam mkha'i gsung ngo //
translated: The speech which teaches selflessness is the space-speech.

original: de @258b rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de @258b rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it enters that.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i thugs ni nam mkha'i thugs so //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i thugs ni nam mkha'i thugs so //
translated: The mind of the utterly pure sphere of phenomena is the mind of space.

original: der chos ni yongs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: der chos ni yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: There, phenomena are enjoyed.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ste dam pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ste dam pa'o //
translated: They are the best, the supreme.

original: spyod pa ni kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Conduct is the practice.

original: de nyid ni gzhi dang gnas te de nyid la gnas nas sangs rgyas nyid dang sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni gzhi dang gnas te de nyid la gnas nas sangs rgyas nyid dang sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the basis and the abode, because one abides in that and accomplishes buddhahood.

original: sems kun la spyod pas na kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: sems kun la spyod pas na kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: Because it is practiced in all minds, it is called practice.

original: le'u bco brgyad pa las /
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad pa las /
translated: In the eighteenth chapter it says:

original: sems kun la ni spyod pa ste //üîΩkun du spyod pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems kun la ni spyod pa ste // kun du spyod pa zhes bshad do //
translated: It is practiced in all mindsüîΩand is explained as practice.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is practiced in all minds, it is called practice.

original: de'i don du de gtso bor gyur pa ni kun du spyod pa mchog gi le'u'o //
analyzed: de'i don du de gtso bor gyur pa ni kun du spyod pa mchog gi le'u'o //
translated: The meaning of that is that it is the chapter of supreme practice.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i bshad sbyar snyim pa'i me tog las le'u lnga pa'o /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i bshad sbyar snyim pa'i me tog las le'u lnga pa'o /
translated: This is the fifth chapter of the Blossoming Lotus, a commentary on the Guhyasamaja.

original: // / dngos grub mchog gi nye ba'i sgrub pa ni le'u 'di'i don yin te /
analyzed: // / dngos grub mchog gi nye ba'i sgrub pa ni le'u 'di'i don yin te /
translated: The proximate practice for supreme spiritual power is the meaning of this chapter.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Its definition is:

original: drag shul rjes su chags pa ni //
analyzed: drag shul rjes su chags pa ni //
translated: Wrathful and passionate,

original: nye bar bsgrub pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrub pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: The vow of close practice.

original: zhes bya bas bstan te nye bar bsgrub pa gtan la phab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bstan te nye bar bsgrub pa gtan la phab pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus it is taught. The meaning is that the close practice is determined.

original: de la mngon par rtogs pa las byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags lnga ni rjes su chags pa ste sems dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par rtogs pa las byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags lnga ni rjes su chags pa ste sems dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, the five mantras of consecration in the clear realization are the passionate one, because they delight the mind.

original: de rnams kyis mngon du bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni drag shul te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis mngon du bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni drag shul te /
translated: The clear realization that is to be realized by those is the wrathful one,

original: zab cing phra ba'i dngos po la drag shul gyis yid 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab cing phra ba'i dngos po la drag shul gyis yid 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one engages the mind with wrath toward subtle and profound things.

original: drag shul gyi spyod pa ni dam tshig gi drag shul lo //
analyzed: drag shul gyi spyod pa ni dam tshig gi drag shul lo //
translated: The practice of wrath is the wrathful commitment.

original: nye ba'i longs spyod dang dka' spyod dag ni dam tshig gi rjes su chags pa ste de dag gi lha rnams chags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba'i longs spyod dang dka' spyod dag ni dam tshig gi rjes su chags pa ste de dag gi lha rnams chags par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The close enjoyment and the difficult practice are the passionate commitment, because they cause the deities to be passionate.

original: de dag thams cad le'u bzhi rnams su ston to //
analyzed: de dag thams cad le'u bzhi rnams su ston to //
translated: All of those are taught in the four chapters.

original: de la mngon par rtogs pa ni gtso bo yin te de'i yan lag drug ste ;
analyzed: de la mngon par rtogs pa ni gtso bo yin te de'i yan lag drug ste ;
translated: Among them, the clear realization is the principal one, and it has six branches.

original: sngags dgong pa dang / phyag rgya chen po dang / de'i spyad pa dang sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdo rje rnams dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngags dgong pa dang / phyag rgya chen po dang / de'i spyad pa dang sku dang gsung dang thugs dang ye shes rdo rje rnams dang phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams dang sku la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa rnams so //
translated: The six branches are the six perfections, the six topics of knowledge, the six families, the six deities, the six seals, the six mantras, the great seal, the practice of that, and the blessings of the vajra body, speech, mind, and gnosis, the subtle yoga, and the blessings of the body, and so forth.

original: yan lag drug po de rnams las drug po ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin te ;
analyzed: yan lag drug po de rnams las drug po ni 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin te ;
translated: From among those six branches, the six are primary because they are the result.üîΩTherefore, the chapter is taught from that perspective, and at the end the name of the chapter is taught:

original: de bas na de'i sgo nas de'i don ston pa'i mthar le'u'i ming dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o zhes bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i sgo nas de'i don ston pa'i mthar le'u'i ming dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o zhes bya ba bstan te /

original: rdo rje bkod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje bkod pa'i le'u zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the chapter is the arrangement of the vajra.

analyzed: sku la sogs pa byin gyis rlob pa de'i le'u don gyi gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por bstan gyi @259a * //
translated: The blessing of the body, and so forth, is taught first because it is the main topic of the chapter,

analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dang po yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /

original: sku gsung thugs kyis mtshan pa yi //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyis mtshan pa yi //
translated: The first of the realizations is the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: chos kyi tshig rnams rab tu brjod //üîΩces bya bas mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar gsungs pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig rnams rab tu brjod // ces bya bas mngon par rtogs pa'i mthar gsungs pa'i phyir mi rigs so //

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: des ni thugs byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: des ni thugs byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: By that, one should bless the mind.

analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bya'o //

analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje'o //
